text: vscode: I hit CMD+Return to run a file, nothing happens, ok, hit it again, suprise: it was just a lag, now we run the program TWO times for your convenience. The lag in the first place. But it’s also showing a minute of scrolling movements I made to verify if something hangs… after the program finishes the second time

text: The difference is that all keyboard input is queued, so hitting CMD-Return runs a program as often as you hit the key

elements.text: The difference is that all keyboard input is queued, so hitting CMD-Return runs a program as often as you hit the key

text: I'd recommend only hitting it once then :stuck_out_tongue:
